news.title: Viem vs. Ethers.js: A Detailed Comparison for Web3 Developers
news.subtitle: This blog explores the differences, benefits, and trade-offs between Ethers.js and Viem for building dapps on Ethereum

childMarkdownRemark.html:
When building dapps on Ethereum, choosing the right library can significantly impact your development process and project success. Two prominent libraries in this space are Ethers.js and Viem. Both offer a powerful set of tools for connecting to smart contracts, sending transactions, and querying blockchain data with official support for TypeScript. Both libraries also adopt a modular design, allowing for the selective inclusion of library parts to optimize bundle size and application performance.

In this blog post, we'll explore these libraries in detail, highlighting their key differences, benefits, and trade-offs, as well as when to use one over the other. In the end, you should have all the information you need to decide when starting your next project.

The key difference between Ethers.js and Viem


While they share a common goal, Ethers.js and Viem differ significantly in their approach and features, catering to varied developer preferences and project requirements.

Ethers.js


  • Providers in Ethers.js: Ethers.js uses providers as a bridge to the Ethereum network. These providers are versatile objects through which developers can read blockchain data or send transactions. Ethers.js simplifies the connection process to various Ethereum nodes via multiple provider types, including default, JSON-RPC, and Infura providers. This abstraction allows developers to concentrate more on their dapp's functionality rather than on the complexities of network connection.
  • Maturity and Stability: Ethers.js offers a long history and a robust support community, making it a reliable choice for complex projects. With a comprehensive feature set, it provides a wide range of functionalities, ideal for developers seeking a one-stop solution for Ethereum interaction. Despite its comprehensive nature, Ethers.js maintains a modular design, allowing developers to pick and choose specific functionalities.

Viem


  • Actions with Viem: Viem introduces the concept of actions ‚Äî functions dedicated to executing specific tasks on the Ethereum network. These can be categorized into public actions (like retrieving a transaction) and wallet actions (such as sending a transaction). Designed for composability and modularity, Viem's actions enable developers to craft Ethereum applications with greater clarity and efficiency.
  • Efficiency and Minimalism: Viem focuses on a minimalist design, optimizing for efficiency with a smaller bundle size and selective execution of tasks. It emphasizes modularity and composability through its APIs, enabling a leaner, more efficient development process. With an innovative approach, Viem aims for a straightforward API design, prioritizing clarity and ease of use to enhance the developer experience.

Choosing between Ethers.js and Viem


Choosing between Ethers.js and Viem depends on the specific needs of your project and your preferences as a developer.

  • Ethers.js is best suited for projects that demand a comprehensive set of features and prioritize maturity and community support. It's ideal for complex dapps requiring extensive interaction with the Ethereum network.
  • Viem is the go-to choice for projects where efficiency, a lightweight bundle, and a minimalist design are key considerations. It shines in web applications focused on speed and performance, as well as for developers who prefer a modular and innovative approach to Ethereum interaction.

Benefits and Tradeoffs of Ethers.js and Viem


Ethers.js


Benefits:

  • Broad range of features and strong community support.
  • High stability and reliability derived from its maturity.

Tradeoffs:

  • Potentially overwhelming for projects that do not require its extensive feature set.
  • Managing dependencies and external providers can add complexity.

Viem


Benefits:

  • Efficient and lightweight, perfect for performance-sensitive applications.
  • Simplifies the development process with its modular design and clear documentation.

Tradeoffs:

  • Less mature than Ethers.js, with a smaller community and fewer resources.
  • May require more effort to manage due to its unopinionated, modular nature.

Technical differences between Ethers.js and Viem


Below is an enhanced comparison table between Ethers.js and Viem, featuring code examples and brief explanations for various functionalities. This comparison highlights the structural and conceptual differences in how each library approaches interactions with the Ethereum blockchain.

Other things to keep in mind


Terminology and Conceptual Clarity: The term "provider" is widely used in web3 development but can often lead to confusion due to its overloaded meaning. Viem addresses this by employing the term "Client," categorizing them into Public Client (for blockchain information access), Wallet Client (for transaction signing), and Test Client (for local node testing). This distinction helps developers better navigate the Ethereum interaction landscape.

Bundle Size and Efficiency: Viem is designed with a minimalist modular architecture, boasting a bundle size of only 35kB. This contrasts sharply with Ethers.js, which, due to its broader range of built-in functionalities, results in a larger bundle size and potentially impacts web application performance more significantly.

API Design and Development Experience: Viem opts for verbose APIs, prioritizing flexibility and ease of change. This approach stands in contrast to Ethers.js, which may employ more abstracted APIs for some functionalities, potentially making it harder to modify or extend the codebase. Additionally, leveraging TypeScript, Viem provides strongly typed APIs, enhancing the development experience through features like autocomplete, type inference, and static validation. This reduces the chance of runtime errors and makes the API more intuitive.

Conclusion


Each library offers a distinct approach to interacting with the Ethereum blockchain. Ethers.js tends to abstract complexities through predefined classes and methods, aiming for an object-oriented experience. In contrast, Viem opts for a more function-driven interface, emphasizing explicitness and perhaps offering a slightly steeper learning curve but greater flexibility in certain contexts.

Ethers.js is geared towards developers seeking a comprehensive toolkit for complex dApps, offering a rich set of abstractions and functionalities. On the other hand, Viem caters to those who value efficiency, modularity, and a minimalist design, providing a streamlined and innovative approach to Ethereum development. The choice between the two ultimately rests on the developer's or project's specific requirements and preferences.

image.title: How to swap crypto with MetaMask
image.description: How to swap crypto with MetaMask

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Swapping crypto is fast, easy, and secure with MetaMask. You can choose from thousands of your favorite tokens across nine networks including Ethereum, Linea, Base, and Arbitrum. MetaMask Swaps also include gas fees right in your quotes, making swapping crypto as smooth as can be.

We've simplified cross-chain swapping too. Send&Swap lets you choose the token you want to spend and the token you want the other person to receive ‚Äî all in one move. As ever, safety is essential when it comes to your digital assets. So rest easy. MetaMask Swaps are powered by our razor-tight, industry-leading security.

Below, you'll find step-by-step guides showing you how to swap crypto with MetaMask.

Let‚Äôs get into it! ü¶ä

How to swap crypto with MetaMask Extension

  1. Open the MetaMask browser extension.
  2. Select the network you want to swap on, and click the Swap button.
  3. Select the token you want to swap from. Example: ETH.
  4. Enter the amount that you want to swap.
  5. Select the token you want to swap to. Example: DAI.
  6. A preferred quote will be loaded automatically. To select a different quote, click View all quotes.
  7. Click Swap to confirm.

Success! ü¶ä

How to swap crypto with MetaMask App

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask mobile app.
  2. Select the network you want to swap on, located at the top of your screen. Example: Ethereum Mainnet.
  3. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  4. Tap Swap.
  5. Select the token you want to swap from by tapping the token name that appears under your wallet address. Example: ETH.
  6. Enter the amount that you want to swap.
  7. Select the token you want to swap to. Example: DAI.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Note: you can manually select a different quote from our range of industry-leading providers.
  9. Tap Swap to confirm.

Success! ü¶ä

How to swap crypto with MetaMask Portfolio

  1. Connect your MetaMask wallet to portfolio.metamask.io
  2. Click Move crypto.
  3. Click Swap.
  4. Select the network you want to swap from in the dropdown menu. Example: Ethereum.
  5. Select the token you want to swap from. Example: ETH.
  6. Enter the amount that you want to swap.
  7. Select the token you want to swap to. Example: DAI.
  8. Click Get Quotes to proceed. Note: you can manually select a different quote from our range of industry-leading providers.
  9. Click Swap to confirm.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to start swapping crypto? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Check out our MetaMask Support guide about swapping crypto.

nodes.title: Introducing MetaMask Card pilot launch
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Card lets you spend crypto anywhere Mastercard is accepted.

image.title: MetaMask Card pilot launch
image.description: MetaMask Card pilot launch continues in the EU, UK, M√©xico, Colombia, and Brazil.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask, Mastercard, and Baanx (Crypto Life) have launched MetaMask Card pilot,¬†letting you make everyday purchases with your crypto anywhere Mastercard is accepted. MetaMask Card functions like a crypto debit card, so you can spend directly from your MetaMask wallet.

MetaMask Card pilot is currently available in the EU, UK, Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia. To get started, head to MetaMask Portfolio and click on the Card tab. Eligible users will be redirected to the Crypto Life platform to set up their account and card.

‚ÄúMetaMask Card pilot gives people more freedom to spend crypto,‚Äù says Lorenzo Santos, Senior Product Manager at Consensys. ‚ÄúMetaMask Card represents a major step to removing the friction that has traditionally existed between the blockchain and real-world commerce. This is a paradigm shift that offers the best of both worlds.‚Äù

Chief Commercial Officer at Baanx, Simon Jones shares, "we are so delighted to partner with web3‚Äôs leading wallet, MetaMask, to power the financial revolution by enabling users to be their own bank.‚Äù

Accelerating crypto adoption by removing barriers to spending

In the past, off-ramping crypto to cash was clunky, and required many steps. This tedious process hindered mainstream adoption of crypto as a practical, real-world payment method. MetaMask Card removes the need to transfer your funds to a centralized exchange or a bank in order to spend your crypto. This not only paves the way for increased adoption, it also aligns with the MetaMask vision of empowering people with self-custody.

Most traditional crypto cards operate similarly to prepaid cards, where you need to transfer funds to a third party before spending them. MetaMask Card is because it functions like a debit card. This means card holders can directly use the crypto in their MetaMask wallet for everyday purchases, and maintain control over their funds until the exact moment of payment. MetaMask Card utilizes Mastercard's global merchant network, combined with the security of MetaMask and the efficiency of Linea secured by the Ethereum network. This trio brings a swift, cost-effective, and secure spending experience, whether online or for in store purchases.

Global expansion of MetaMask Card

Get your MetaMask Card today, and begin using it immediately via digital wallet integrations with Apple Pay or Google Pay. Note: Eligible currencies include USDC, USDT, and WETH on Linea network. If you're outside of the EU, UK, Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia ‚Äî you're not forgotten. MetaMask Card pilot is rolling out globally over the coming months. Join our waitlist to stay in the loop, and find out when MetaMask Card will be available where you are.

Need extra help? We got you. Check out our MetaMask Card Support Guide for more details.

MetaMask is the gateway to the decentralized web, enabling you to do more. Users can connect to any dapp, on any network, from any device. From DeFi to DeSci, gaming to NFTs, and beyond: MetaMask is passionate about the web3 community. Our More With MetaMask Partner Series shines a light on builders who are innovating across the ecosystem. Next up, Banxa.

Navigating crypto used to be a complicated process, but no longer. At Banxa, our mission is to simplify crypto onboarding. As a leading crypto on-ramp and off-ramp solution integrated with MetaMask, we exchange your fiat money for cryptocurrency and vice versa.

Without Banxa, crypto wallets like MetaMask would need numerous integrations, partnerships, and licenses to help their users buy and sell crypto. This process is time-consuming, resource intensive, and involves additional risks and regulatory responsibilities. Banxa handles all of these logistics, so MetaMask can focus on what matters ‚Äì building web3 products that users love.

Configurable crypto journeys

Tailored experiences: MetaMask‚Äôs configurability ensures the best experience for every customer, whether you are a new or returning user.

Streamlined onboarding: For new users, Banxa minimizes the steps needed to buy and sell crypto.

Effortless transactions: Returning users can complete purchases in just one click without leaving MetaMask app, thanks to prior verification.

Worldwide user reach

MetaMask's commitment to accessibility works in tandem with Banxa's vision of global web3 onboarding. Leveraging MetaMask's user-friendly interface and extensive features, Banxa reaches a wider audience, providing an easy gateway to the world of cryptocurrencies. MetaMask‚Äôs configurability also improves our ability to deliver superior experiences to Banxa users.

Powerful web3 APIs

MetaMask provides a robust suite of web3 APIs that serve as a gold standard for product integration. These APIs offer a seamless and standardized approach for Banxa to connect its services with MetaMask, enabling smooth user experiences and efficient transactions.

By integrating Banxa's smooth on-ramp and off-ramp solutions with MetaMask, we've made it easier than ever for users to navigate the decentralized web. The complexity of crypto is no longer a barrier to entry.

Experience the ease of buying crypto with MetaMask via Banxa today.

Looking for more help? We got you. Learn how to buy crypto on MetaMask.
